title: Ethereum Gas Fee Surges to 12-Month High as PEPE Frenzy Grips Market - CoinDesk
summary: Ethereum gas fee surges to 12-month high as PEPE frenzy grips market. New coin PEPE reached $500 million in market cap within 3 weeks, with similar frenzied activity seen in smaller coins CHAD, 4TOKEN, and DINO. These coins have rallied 450%, 250%, and 500% respectively in a short period of time.

title: DCG’s Barry Silbert Sells $755K Worth of Grayscale Ethereum Classic Trust Shares - Decrypt
summary: Barry Silbert, CEO of Digital Currency Group (DCG), has sold $755K worth of Grayscale Ethereum Classic Trust (ETCG) shares. This is the first time he has sold any of his ETCG shares, according to SEC filings. The sale represents a small portion of the fund's $225M assets under management and 14M outstanding shares, of which Silbert is a 10% shareholder. The sale was brokered by Cannacord Genuity on April 28 on the OTCQX market. Silbert's shares were originally purchased in privately negotiated transactions between 2017-2018. The sale is somewhat surprising given Silbert's history as a crypto "permbull." DCG-owned lending desk Genesis owes $630M to Gemini, a crypto exchange and custodian owned by the Winklevoss twins, and the companies have entered into a 30-day mediation process to settle the outstanding loan balance.

title: Ethereum Developers Outline Plans for 'Dencun' Network Upgrade - Unchained - Unchained
summary: Ethereum developers have outlined plans for the next major network upgrade, Dencun, which includes a key feature called Proto-Danksharding or "The Surge." This upgrade will significantly lower transaction costs on Layer 2 networks by introducing temporary data blobs that can store transaction/proof data currently stored elsewhere. The upgrade also includes three other Ethereum Improvement Proposals (EIPs) to improve blockspace availability, make transaction formats forward-compatible, and deactivate code used to terminate smart contracts. The exact timeline for the upgrade has not been specified, but the next update on Dencun's finalized scope is expected to be announced with the first testnet fork.

title: Ethereum had over US$635 mln in NFT wash trades in April, CryptoSlam reveals - Forkast News
summary: Ethereum had over $635 million in non-fungible token (NFT) wash trades in April, according to new data from CryptoSlam. This represents nearly 60% of all NFT trades on the blockchain for the month. Wash trades, which involve an investor acting as both the buyer and seller of a financial instrument to manipulate prices, made up a significant portion of NFT trading activity on Ethereum in April. The data also revealed wash trading activities on other blockchains, including Solana, Binance, Polygon, Cardano, Flow, and Arbitrum. The practice of wash trading is illegal in U.S. securities markets and can be used to manipulate prices and generate misleading trading volume.

title: How Cardano's Hydra Layer-2 Is Challenging Bitcoin Lightning Network and Ethereum Sharding - DailyCoin
summary: Cardano's Hydra Layer-2 scaling solution has been released and is challenging Bitcoin Lightning Network and Ethereum Sharding. Hydra introduces a novel scaling solution that could make Cardano the fastest and most scalable network. Cardano has long been vying for a spot among the top cryptocurrency projects, and with Hydra, it has solidified its position as a major player. Hydra is an isomorphic scaling solution that replicates Cardano's functionality and security guarantees on an off-chain ledger network while maintaining communication between the two layers. It operates similarly to state-channel solutions like Bitcoin's Lightning Network and Ethereum's Raiden Network, allowing users to securely and instantly perform transactions on private networks and settle the result on the main chain. Hydra brings a solid solution, allowing Cardano to compete with Ethereum and Bitcoin. However, comparing or saying one is better wouldn't be fair, as each scalability solution has its pros and cons and addresses different challenges.

title: Ethereum Median Gas Fee Hit 12-Month High Amid Memecoin Resurgence - CryptoPotato
summary:
Here is a summary of the article in 256 tokens or less:

Ethereum gas fees have reached a 12-month high due to the resurgence of memecoins and increased NFT trading. Median gas fees have surged to $87, up from $10 in just a few months. This has caused frustration among users, making it expensive for small-scale users to participate in the Ethereum ecosystem. The community is working on solutions, including EIP 4844, to reduce gas fees. In the meantime, users are adjusting their strategies, such as performing transactions during off-peak hours or switching to alternative blockchain networks.

title: You Can Mint a Free Ethereum NFT for King Charles’ Coronation - Decrypt
summary:
Here is a summary of the article in less than 256 tokens:

The NFTs, called "The Oath," can be claimed on Nifty Gateway or through a QR code in the newspaper. The artwork depicts Saint Edward's Crown and represents centuries of tradition and history. title: Securities vs. Commodities: What's the Difference and Why it Matters For Crypto - CoinDesk
summary: Decentralization is key to avoiding securities law violations in crypto. Issuers use decentralized governance structures like DAOs and proof-of-stake consensus mechanisms to distribute control and reduce reliance on a central group. This makes it less likely for regulators to classify assets as securities, as there is no central coordinator driving up value. By involving multiple parties in the growth and decision-making process, decentralization reduces reliance on a single "third party" and meets the Howey test requirement for investment returns.

title: Binance Lists PEPE as Meme Coin Market Cap Hits $1 Billion - Decrypt

summary:

The meme coin mania has supercharged ETH deflation, despite the ongoing bear market. However, the sustainability of this trend is uncertain, and ETH burn may subside once the meme craze ends. Investors should follow the deflation/inflation curve of ETH to position themselves better.

title: Memecoin hype drives Bitcoin transaction fees to multi-year highs - Cointelegraph
summary: Bitcoin transaction fees have reached multi-year highs due to the trading frenzy of memecoins like Pepe Coin (PEPE). Transaction fees surged in early May, reaching $3.5 million, a 400% increase from late April. The average Bitcoin transaction fee reached $7.2, according to YCharts. The increase is primarily attributed to BRC-20 transactions, which accounted for 50% of all Bitcoin transactions on May 2. The BRC-20 token standard has become a major trend in the cryptocurrency industry, particularly amid the growth of PEPE. Gas fees on the Ethereum blockchain have also been skyrocketing to new multi-month highs. Despite the latest spike in Bitcoin transaction fees, the current cost is still far from all-time high levels.

title: Why Is Hydra Important for Cardano's Scalability? - DailyCoin
summary:
Cardano's new scaling solution, Hydra, is a significant development in the blockchain space, as it addresses the issue of scalability and efficiency. Hydra is a Layer-2 isomorphic scaling solution that creates a network of off-chain ledgers with the security guarantees and functionality of the Cardano main chain. This allows developers and users to instantly process transactions, scripts, metadata, and more as if on the Cardano chain and then settle the final result on the main chain.

Hydra is still under development, but it has the potential to make Cardano the fastest payment network in the world, according to Charles Hoskinson, the founder of Cardano. The protocol introduces a novel state channel framework that allows for instant off-chain transactions, and it is customizable, allowing developers to tailor it to their dApps' needs.

Cardano has seen significant increases in financial and ecosystem metrics due to increased dApp transactions and the adoption of new stablecoins in Q1 2023. Hydra is an open-source project with hundreds of developers worldwide working on it, and it has the potential to bring scalability and practicality
